publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: A treatise of the nature and vse of things indifferent : Tendinge to proue, that the ceremonies in present controuersie amongst the ministers of the gospell in the realme of Englande, are neither in nature nor vse indifferent
monogr.author: Bradshaw, William

div.head: THE PRINTER TO THE Reader.
div.p: A Copy of this Treatisse by the prouidence of God cōming into my hand: I thought it behoofull for my Countrimen, that they should be made acquainted with it, that by meanes thereof they might receaue som lyght of the truth for which so many suffer. The author whosoeuer hee is hath litle cause to be offended with it, The paines he hath taken in it, doth perswad me that he cannot but desier the same in it self though daunger & want of meanes might hinder him from publishing it, But howsoeuer (good reader) accept it as a testimonie of my vowes for the good of my Countrey, the weale whereof shall euer possesse me, though I cannot possesse it.
